title: Better than I thought
comment: Maybe I'm missing something. I wanted to play flac on my smartphone. This seems to do the the job, but when I connect to a hi-fi, I need to turn the volume up so high there's a hum in the silent bits. This is not the case with my Sansa Fuze. I imagine it would be fine with headphones, but if I use those, I might as well as well listen to vbr mp3. Gingerbread Alc. OT-983. Revised - the flac I tried initially was a poor (studio) quality recording. Though AndLess doesn't quite have the oomph of my Fuze, it's better than I thought and I've upgraded my review to fours stars.

title: Won't play flac files
comment: Not what I need

title: andLess is theBest
comment: I found it amazingly simple to install and use. All I really needed it for was to play my APE files. That is the lossless compression program I use to compress my cd collection and put it on my computer. I find that APE files come out smaller than 320k Mp3 files sometimes. Now to find a 2.4 GHZ 1-bit bit-streaming (SCD) app... It is a bit short on features, but that isn't what I got it for. Works fine for me. And the price is right. How can anyone complain about something someone spent time on making and then released it for free? To those who don't like it, maybe you should think about programming a better one for yourself.

title: Simple FLAC player, but...
comment: I've installed only to listen FLAC music files. Occasionally, I listen MP3s files too. However, I think there is a bug somewhere, because after 4 or maybe 6 music files, the playing is stopped  unexpectedly, in the middle of the song. When I check the application windows, it says "stopped" (not paused), but I don't know why. I am listening large files (>1h, >50MB, even 300 or 700MB), like 2 or 3 files per day, and suddenly, after 2-3 days, this issue is occurring and annoying me, because I have to search through my pockets, activate the phone, checking if there is another notification that might have stopped the audio but there isn't, open andLess and trying to figure it out which file I was listening and where in the timeline the audio has stopped.  Another issue: if the music is stopped (it says "stopped" in the left upper corner), regardless if it's stopped by me or by the previously issue, there is no info where is/was the playing position within the playlist or folder. It should store the name of the file which was last played, or maybe a visual hint (little arrow, file name written in different font, background of the file, or anything like that).

title: Excellent
comment: Just Works with a nice simple UI with a direct view of the existing file structure - doesn't try to take over your music-life. It's about time that flac was much more widely supported - there is little reason to use lossy music formats in these days of huge hard drives and fast connections. Hopefully this will promote flac's wider adoption on Android. Thanks.

Excellent app. Worth paying for and as it's free that's even better.  ALAC support at last!

title: Excellent Simple Application

title: Simple
comment: Just work

title: One at a time with ICS
comment: This app worked quite well on my Nexus S 4G with Gingerbread. However, after installing ICS from a factory image via fastboot, the app only plays one apple lossless file in a directory then returns to the top level directory on the SDcard. Please fix it. This is the only app in the Android Market that can actually play my Apple lossless files and I am getting tired of playing files one at a time.

title: Massive Potential
comment: Installed this because it played lossless audio i.e. FLAC. Absolutely love it. It is for me playing the whole album continuously. Listening to Evanescence and it sounds great. Please keep this free. Love the nice simple interface as I want it to use the least amount of battery. Improvement? Stereo widening would be amazing. EQ  i.e. integration with HTC enhancement. Other than that, great!  Update: you may need .cue or .m3u file in same folder for continuous song playback (I have both)

When I manually started the second track, it played OK, but when on playlist, only the first file is getting played.
